alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 8:05PM EDT until June 23 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Virginia and eastern West Virginia, including the following counties: in northwest Virginia, City of Winchester and Frederick. In eastern West Virginia, Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms approaching from the north. Additional flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winchester... Millwood Pike... Stephens City... Middletown... Albin... Gainesboro... Cedar Grove... High View Manor... Gore... Cross Junction... Rock Enon Springs... Whitacre... Greenwood... Armel... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
